p: CHIKV titres in saliva were significantly higher in Ae. geniculatus vs Ae. albopictus (stratified Mann–Whitney-Wilcoxon rank sum test, p-value = 1.8e-3), with 0.24 log 10 difference between values average across time points (0.51 vs 0.27 log 10 FFU/mL for Ae. geniculatus and Ae. albopictus, respectively). Titres in heads were significantly different across time points after virus exposure in mosquitoes from the Ae. geniculatus species only (Kruskal–Wallis rank sum test, p-value = 4e-03 and 0.14 for Ae. geniculatus and Ae. albopictus, respectively). Virus titres in saliva were clearly increasing over time in mosquitoes from the Ae. geniculatus species.
